question: Which one of the following is true regarding VLANs?

options.A: Two VLANs are configured by default on all Cisco switches.
options.B: VLANs only work if you have a complete Cisco switched internetwork. No off-brand switches are allowed.
options.C: You should not have more than 10 switches in the same VTP domain.
options.D: VTP is used to send VLAN information to switches in a configured VTP domain.

answer_description: Switches do not propagate VLAN information by default; you must configure the VTP domain. VLAN Trunking Protocol (VTP) is used to propagate VLAN information across a trunk link.

question: What type of RJ45 UTP cable is used between switches?

options.D: Crossover with a router in between the two switches

answer_description: To connect two switches together, you would use a RJ45 UTP crossover cable.

question: Which of the following describe the DHCP Discover message?It usesFF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FFas a layer 2 broadcast.It uses UDP as the Transport layer protocol.It uses TCP as the Transport layer protocol.It does not use a layer 2 destination address.
answer_description: A client that sends out a DHCP Discover message in order to receive an IP address sends out a broadcast at both layer 2 and layer 3. The layer 2 broadcast is all Fs in hex, orFF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF. The layer 3 broadcast is255.255.255.255, which means all networks and all hosts. DHCP is connectionless, which means it uses User Datagram Protocol (UDP) at the Transport layer, also called the Host-to-Host layer.

question: Which of the following are TCP/IP protocols used at the Application layer of the OSI model?IPTCPTelnetFTPTFTP
answer_description: Telnet, File Transfer Protocol (FTP), and Trivial FTP (TFTP) are all Application layer protocols. IP is a Network layer protocol. Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) is a Transport layer protocol.

question: What keystroke will terminate setup mode?
answer_description: You can exit setup mode at any time by using the keystrokeCtrl+C.

question: You need to gather the IP address of a remote switch that is located in Hawaii. What can you do to find the address?

options.A: Issue theshow ip arpcommand on the router connected to the switch.
options.B: Issue theshow ip routecommand on the router connected to the switch.
options.C: Issue theshow cdp neighborcommand on the router connected to the switch.
options.D: Issue theshow cdp neighbors detailcommand on the router connected to the switch.

answer_description: Although option A is certainly the "best" answer, unfortunately option  D will work just fine and your boss would probably prefer you to use theshow cdp neighbors detailcommand.

question:
You get a call from a network administrator who tells you that he typed the following into his router:Router(config)#router ospf 1
Router(config-router)#network 10.0.0.0 255.0.0.0 area 0He tells you he still can't see any routes in the routing table. What configuration error did the administrator make?

options.C: The OSPF Process ID is incorrect.

answer_description: The administrator typed in the wrong wildcard mask configuration. The wildcard should have been 0.0.0.255.

question: You want to improve network performance by increasing the bandwidth available to hosts and limit the size of the broadcast domains. Which of the following options will achieve this goal?
answer_description: By creating and implementing VLANs in your switched network, you can break up broadcast domains at layer 2. For hosts on different VLANs to communicate, you must have a router or layer 3 switch.

question: What is the maximum distance with maximum data rate for 802.11a?
answer_description: The IEEE 802.11a standard provides a maximum data rate of up to 54Mbps, but you need to be close to the access point, somewhere around 65 to 75 feet.

question: Cisco's Unified Wireless Solution provides a mesh solution. What devices do you absolutely need to purchase to run a Cisco solution?WCSControllerAccess pointBridge
answer_description: The Cisco Unified Wireless Solution is a great product, but you must purchase specialized devices. Cisco managed access points and a controller are the devices you need to purchase to run the Unified Wireless Solution.

question: You need to configure a router for a Frame Relay connection to a non-Cisco router. Which of the following commands will prepare the WAN interface of the router for this connection?
answer_description: If you have a Cisco router on one side of a Frame Relay network and a non-Cisco router on the other side, you would need to use the Frame Relay encapsulation type of IETF. The default is Cisco encapsulation, which means that a Cisco router must be on both sides of the Frame Relay network.
